title: I Received 1099-C that indicates the debt is from a Bankruptcy ("Identifiable Event Code: A") , do I still need to file a 942 ?
question: I wrote an Avvo question earlier and forgot to mention this important piece of information on the 1099-c (Cancellation of Debt) that the "amount of debt discharged" is from filing Bankruptcy.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Debt,Debt discharge,Bankruptcy and debt,Unemployment compensation,Paying taxes on unemployment compensation,Tax return,Tax law
answers: File a tax return and attach form 982. Because of the 1099, the IRS computer will assume you had that as income. Only by filing the 1040 and the 982 can you counter that assumption. Not a big deal to file - it just lets the IRS computer know why taxes are not due on the 1099 income.
The answer to your questions is better directed to a tax preparer, CPA or accountant. Good luck.

You may still need to file and pay income taxes, even if your entire source of income is from unemployment.
I think you may be referring to IRS Form 982.
